wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Edward "Tug" Wilson (18 January 1921 - 2 January 2009) was the founder and first commander of the Abu Dhabi Defence Force, the forerunner of the current UAE Armed Forces.  He was a personal friend of Sheikh Zayed, with whom he shared interests in falconry and horseback riding, establishing the United Arab Emirates (UAE) Royal Stables in 1974.
